template.@test_function<desc>: Test function just for development use

@test_function.@purpose: For what is used the QUERY below

template.@pagemap<desc>: Pagemap node contains general thresholds for the pagemap recognition.

pagemap.@preflight_columns<desc>: Preflight colums druring preflight method. Set to 0 if this information is not required.
pagemap.@preflight_artifact_w4<desc>: Element height(for images) or font size(for text) weight.
pagemap.@preflight_artifact_distance<desc>: Maximum distance<0,1> when elements can be an artifact/header/footer.
pagemap.@preflight_artifact_distance<use>: Detection of headers/footers and other artifacts in Preflight process.
pagemap.@preflight_artifact_cluster_points<desc>: Minimal number of points in preflight_artifact_distance radian.
pagemap.@preflight_artifact_cluster_points<use>: Detection of headers/footers and other artifacts in Preflight process. Higher value causes that only offen repeated headers are detected.
pagemap.@concurrent_threads<desc>: The number of concurrent threads. If zero, the number of concurrent threads supported by the implementation is used. If it's set to 1, no parallel algorithms are used.
pagemap.@rotation_detect<desc>: Detect and correct page rotation for reading.
pagemap.@background_color_diff<desc>: Page background color max color component difference.
pagemap.@bbox_expansion<desc>: Bounding box expansion - half of kTrTextHeight.
pagemap.@angle_deviation<desc>: Maximum angle deviation for horizontal and vertical elements.
pagemap.@header_ratio<desc>: Maximum percentage of a header height. Possible values from interval [0,1].
pagemap.@footer_ratio<desc>: Maximum percentage of a footer height. Possible values from interval [0,1].
pagemap.@artifact_border_distance_max<desc>: Maximum distance of artifact to page border.
pagemap.@artifact_font_size<desc>: All texts with font size bigger then this is artifact.
pagemap.@artifact_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when object or element is an artifact normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@object_isolated<desc>: Maximum isolated object heigh and width. It's used for joining isolated objects.
pagemap.@path_object_max<desc>: Maximum number of subsequence path objects that are still paths.
pagemap.@path_object_min<desc>: Minimum number of subsequence path objects that are still paths.
pagemap.@isolated_text_ratio<desc>: Maximum isolated text width ratio. Is multiplied with the font size.
pagemap.@isolated_element_ratio<desc>: Maximum isolated element width/height ratio. Is multiplied with the font size.
pagemap.@initial_element_expansion<desc>: Initial element bounding box expansion when searching children. Size in points. If its zero, a half of default page font size is used.
pagemap.@element_isolated_caption<desc>: If set to 1 and element contains caption(table, image, chart, note) do not mark it as isolated element.
pagemap.@element_isolated_width_min<desc>: Minimal value of bbox width for isolated element. If zero, element_isolated_width_min_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@element_isolated_width_min_ratio<desc>: Minimal value of bbox width for isolated element multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@element_isolated_width_max<desc>: Maximal value of bbox width for isolated element. If zero, element_isolated_width_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@element_isolated_width_max_ratio<desc>: Maximal value of bbox width for isolated element multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@element_isolated_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when element is isolated normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@element_isolated_image_w3<desc>: Images area vs join image area weight.
pagemap.@element_isolated_image_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when isolated elements can be added to an image.
pagemap.@element_isolated_image_similarity<use>: Isolated elements process. Use higher value to join isolated elements to nearest images.
pagemap.@element_line_width_max<desc>: Maximal value of line width. If zero, element_line_width_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@element_line_width_max_ratio<desc>: Maximal value of line width multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@element_line_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when element is recognized as line normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@element_alignment_ratio<desc>: Ration between baseline and bounding box alignments. Bounding box alignment precision is multiplied with element_alignment_ratio.
pagemap.@rect_image_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when rectangle is image normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@image_background_text<use>: Image detection. Images that have same size as texts(text beackground) are moved to artifacts.
pagemap.@image_overlap_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value when graphic page objects can be joined. Distance in points.
pagemap.@image_overlap_distance<use>: Image detection. Lower value leaves possible labels isolated.
pagemap.@image_join_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value when graphic page objects can be joined. Distance in points.
pagemap.@image_join_distance<use>: Image detection. Lower value leaves small isolated images.
pagemap.@char_clip_ratio<desc>: Minimal ratio of the clipping area of the character comparing to it's original size.
pagemap.@word_space_width_ratio<desc>: Default char space width ratio (percentage) based on the font size.
pagemap.@word_space_width_ratio<use>: Words detection. TODO: change to clustering.
pagemap.@word_space_width_min_ratio<use>: Words detection. TODO: change to clustering.
pagemap.@word_space_type<desc>: The space's advance width detection type. If 0, font space width is calculated as average of all characters widths. If -1, maximum width is used. If -2, space character width is used. If there is a number greater then 0, font size(em) multiplied by this number is used.
pagemap.@word_space_type<use>: The space's advance width detection. This info is used later to detect normal word spacing for the selected font.
pagemap.@word_space_distance_max<desc>: Maximum distance between chunks. If zero, word_space_distance_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@word_space_distance_max<use>: Text lines detection. Each space wider then this value splits the line into separate lines.
pagemap.@word_space_distance_max_ratio<desc>: Maximum distance between chunks. The value is multiplied by simple word spacing between words.
pagemap.@word_space_distance_max_ratio<use>: Text lines detection. Each space wider then this value splits the line into separate lines.
pagemap.@word_space_update<desc>: Maximum distance of word spacing. Size in points.
pagemap.@word_space_update<use>: Word spacing detection. Updates maximum space for normal word spacing for each font on the page. Higher value allows variable word spacing in simple paragraph.
pagemap.@word_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value in word spacing detection. If zero, word_distance_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@word_distance<use>: Text lines detection. Higher value allows creating justify paragraphs with not strictly same word spacings.
pagemap.@word_distance_ratio<desc>: Maximum distance value in word spacing detection. The value is multiplied by word font size.
pagemap.@word_distance_ratio<use>: Text lines detection. Higher value allows creating justify paragraphs with not strictly same word spacings.
pagemap.@word_space_splitter_ratio<desc>: Minimum space before splitter. The value is multiplied by most used font size.
pagemap.@word_space_splitter_ratio<use>: Words splitters detection. Use smaller value when columns are close to each other.
pagemap.@word_splitter_distance<desc>: Maximum threshold value for word splitters detections. Real distance in points.
pagemap.@text_line_baseline_ratio<desc>: Maximum baseline shift. Value multiplies minimal font. Baseline shift moves individual characters up or down in relation to other text on the same line.
pagemap.@text_line_baseline_ratio<use>: Baseline detection. The baseline is the line upon which most letters ”sit” and below which descenders extend. Use higher value to smooth baseline shift.
pagemap.@text_line_underline_distance<desc>: Distance of the underline line and text baseline. Size in points.
pagemap.@text_line_underline_char_distance_ratio: Distance of the underline line start/end point and character bounding box. The value is multiplied by line font size. Size in points.
pagemap.@text_line_subscript_space_ratio<desc>: Subscript space multiplied with word space.
pagemap.@text_line_subscript_font_ratio<desc>: Mamimum subscript font size multiplied with line font size.
pagemap.@text_line_subscript_len<desc>: Maximum number of characters in subscript.
pagemap.@text_line_join_font_size_distance<desc>: Distance of two fonts in points, when two lines with different fonts can be join.
pagemap.@text_line_distance_max<desc>: Maximum distance between lines. If zero, text_line_distance_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@text_line_distance_max<use>: Paragraphs detection. Each space wider then this value splits the text into lines.
pagemap.@text_line_distance_max_ratio<desc>: Maximum distance between lines. The value is multiplied by line font size.
pagemap.@text_line_distance_max_ratio<use>: Paragraphs detection. Each space wider then this value splits the text into lines.
pagemap.@text_line_join_distance<desc>: Maximum threshold value in line spacing detection for specific font size. The higher value allows creating paragraph with variable line spacings. The value is multiplied by font size.
pagemap.@text_line_join_distance<use>: Paragraphs detection. The higher value allows creating paragraph with variable line spacings. If zero, the minimum font size is used.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance_max<desc>: Maximum distance between chunks. If zero, text_chunk_distance_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance_max<use>: Text chunks detection. Each space wider then this value splits the line into chunks.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance_max_ratio<desc>: Maximum distance between chunks. The value is multiplied by simple word spacing between words.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance_max_ratio<use>: Text chunks detection. Each space wider then this value splits the line into chunks.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value when text chunks are vertically aligned. If zero, text_chunk_distance_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance<use>: Paragraph detection. Higher value causes identification of tables with not stricly aligned columns.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance_ratio<desc>: Maximum distance value when text chunks are vertically aligned. The value is multiplied by page font width.
pagemap.@text_chunk_distance_ratio<use>: Paragraph detection. Higher value causes identification of tables with not stricly aligned columns.
pagemap.@text_chunk_simple_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value when text chunks create simple line. Normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@text_chunk_word_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value when single line text has to be split to words. Normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@text_height<desc>: Minimal text height on the page.
pagemap.@text_simple_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when text lines create a simple paragraph normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@text_simple_similarity<use>: Paragraph detection. Higher value causes more solid paragraphs.
pagemap.@text_justify_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when text lines create a justify paragraph normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@text_justify_similarity<use>: Paragraph detection. Higher value causes more solid paragraphs.
pagemap.@text_table_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when text lines create a table normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@text_table_similarity<use>: Paragraph detection. Lower value splits lines with larger spaces into chunks to be able to detect tables.
pagemap.@text_paragraph_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when text is paragraph normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@text_split_distance<desc>: Dissimilarity boundary value when text lines creates a paragraph.
pagemap.@text_column_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value that text creates a column normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@label_alignment_h<desc>: Maximum deviation of horizontal label alignment.
pagemap.@label_distance_ratio<desc>: Distance of the label and text. Is multiplied with the page most used font size.
pagemap.@label_baseline_ration<desc>: Multiplies minimal font. Maximum deviation of horizontal label aligned to text.
pagemap.@label_image_w1<desc>: Labels alignment weight. Accepted only if labels overlap.
pagemap.@label_image_w3<desc>: Siblings font size difference weight. Accepted only if it's not equal.
pagemap.@label_image_w8<desc>: Labels type weight. If set to 1, accept only same type labels.
pagemap.@label_image_w9<desc>: Labels graphic state weight. If set to 1, labels have to have same graphics state.
pagemap.@label_image_w10<desc>: Siblings text state weight. If set to 1, siblings have to have same text state.
pagemap.@label_image_width_min<desc>: Minimal value of bbox width for label object. If zero, label_image_width_min_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@label_image_width_min_ratio<desc>: Minimal value of bbox width for label objec multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@label_image_width_max<desc>: Maximal value of bbox width for label object. If zero, label_image_width_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@label_image_width_max_ratio<desc>: Maximal value of bbox width for label object multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@label_image_distance<desc>: Minimum distance value when graphic page object is label. Distance in points.
pagemap.@label_image_distance<use>: Image label detection. Higher value allows more flexibility in labels detection.
pagemap.@label_word_distance<desc>: Maximum distance value when a word is a label. Distance in points.
pagemap.@label_word_distance<use>: Word label detection. Higher value allows more flexibility in labels detection.
pagemap.@label_word_distance_ratio<desc>: Maximum distance value when a word is a label. The value is multiplied by avarage page font width.
pagemap.@label_word_distance_ratio<use>: Word label detection. Higher value allows more flexibility in labels detection.
pagemap.@label_sibling_dist_ratio<desc>: Minimum distance of left lebel sibling. Ratio is multiplied with right sibling distance.
pagemap.@toc_word_distance<desc>: Minimum distance value when word is a label. Distance in points.
pagemap.@toc_word_distance<use>: TOC detection. Higher value allows more flexibility in TOC detection.
pagemap.@graphic_table_alignment_distance<desc>: Maximum alignment distance value when elements can create a table. Distance in points.
pagemap.@graphic_table_split_col_max<desc>: Maximal number of columns when table can be split.
pagemap.@graphic_table_split_row_max<desc>: Maximal number of rows when table can be split.
pagemap.@graphic_table_split_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when graphic table has to be split.
pagemap.@graphic_table_split_similarity<use>: Graphic table detection. Page layout sometimes creates a table. Higher value preserves this layout as table (html), otherwise it's split to elements. It's important for tagging, because it requires strictly defined tables.
pagemap.@graphic_table_split_layout_similarity<d: Minimum similarity value when graphic table has to be split.
pagemap.@graphic_table_split_layout_similarity<u: Graphic table detection. Page layout sometimes creates a table. Higher value preserves this layout as table (html), otherwise it's split to containers. It's important for tagging, because it requires strictly defined tables.
pagemap.@graphic_table_chart_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when graphic table is a char.
pagemap.@graphic_table_chart_similarity<use>: Graphic table detection. Use lower value to recognize charts(images) instead of tables.
pagemap.@graphic_table_image_w1<desc>: Images area weight. If -1, number of images is used.
pagemap.@graphic_table_image_w2<desc>: Images  weight. If -1, number of images is used.
pagemap.@graphic_table_image_w3<desc>: Chart similarity weight. If -1, number of paths is used.
pagemap.@graphic_table_image_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when graphic table has an image.
pagemap.@graphic_table_image_similarity<use>: Graphic table detection. Use lower value to recognize charts(images) instead of tables.
pagemap.@sect_table_row_alignment_type<desc>: Table row alignment type [0 - strong, 1 - average, 2 - weak].
pagemap.@sect_table_row_alignment_type<use>: Table detection. Select strong for strictly aligned rows.
pagemap.@sect_table_col_alignment_type<desc>: Table column alignment type [0 - strong, 1 - average, 2 - weak].
pagemap.@sect_table_col_alignment_type<use>: Table detection. Select strong for strictly aligned columns.
pagemap.@sect_table_col_similarity_type<desc>: Table column similarity type [0 - column alignment distance, 1 - element distance, 2 - element size, 3 - max].
pagemap.@sect_table_col_similarity_type<use>: Table detection. Table columns similarity calculation. Different weights calculation for table elements.
pagemap.@sect_table_col_distance<desc>: Maximum deviation value for detection nearest distancies for table columns. Real distance in points.
pagemap.@sect_table_col_distance<use>: Table detection. Table columns are detected from smallest element distancies. Higher value causes more presize distancies detection.
pagemap.@sect_table_col_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when elements create table column.
pagemap.@sect_table_col_similarity<use>: Table detection. Use lower values for tables that contains paragraps, select higher values for typical tables with numbers.
pagemap.@sect_table_alignment_type<desc>: Table column alignment type [0 - strong, 1 - average, 2 - weak]. Select strong for strictly aligned table elements.
pagemap.@sect_table_alignment_type<use>: Table detection. Use strong for strictly aligned tables.
pagemap.@sect_table_alignment_distance<desc>: Maximum threshold value for detection section tables.
pagemap.@sect_table_alignment_distance<use>: Table detection. Higher value tends to recognize tables. Lower values tends to paragraph detection.
pagemap.@sect_table_text_col_width_min<desc>: Minimal value of bbox width for text in table column. If zero, sect_table_text_col_width_min_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@sect_table_text_col_width_min_ratio<des: Minimal value of bbox width for text in table column multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@sect_table_text_col_width_max<desc>: Maximal value of bbox width for text in table column. If zero, sect_table_text_col_width_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@sect_table_text_col_width_max_ratio<des: Maximal value of bbox width for text in table column multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_gs<desc>: If set to 1, image column has to have same graphics state.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_width_min<desc>: Minimal value of bbox width for image in table column. If zero, sect_table_image_col_width_min_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_width_min_ratio<de: Minimal value of bbox width for image in table column multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_width_max<desc>: Maximal value of bbox width for image in table column. If zero, sect_table_image_col_width_max_ratio is used. Size in points.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_width_max_ratio<de: Maximal value of bbox width for image in table column multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_height_min<desc>: Minimal value of bbox height for image in table column. If zero, sect_table_image_col_height_min_ratio is used.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_height_min_ratio<d: Minimal value of bbox height for image in table column multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_height_max<desc>: Maximal value of bbox height for image in table column. If zero, sect_table_image_col_height_max_ratio is used.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_col_height_max_ratio<d: Maximal value of bbox height for image in table column multiply with average page font size.
pagemap.@sect_table_column_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when elements create table column.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_similarity_w1<desc>: Sect table image similarity area weight.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_similarity_w2<desc>: Sect table image similarity chart weight.
pagemap.@sect_table_image_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when section table is image normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@sect_table_paragraph_similarity<desc>: Minimum similarity value when section table is paragraph normalized to interval [0,1].
pagemap.@table_span_col_ratio<desc>: Intersection percentage of colspan element. Possible values from interval [0,1].
pagemap.@table_span_row_ratio<desc>: Intersection percentage of rowspan element. Possible values from interval [0,1].
pagemap.@table_alignment_h<desc>: Maximum deviation (in points) of horizontal table aligned elements.
pagemap.@table_alignment_v<desc>: Maximum deviation (in points) of vertical table aligned elements.
pagemap.@table_line_intersection<desc>: Expansion (in points) for lines intersection. It's used in table detection.
pagemap.@table_detect_sect<desc>: Texts (not graphic) tables detection. Possible values: 0 | 1. If 0 is set, it prevents generating tables from isolated chunk of text.
pagemap.@caption_distance<desc>: Distance of the caption and the image/table.
pagemap.@caption_alignment_h<desc>: Maximum deviation (in points) in caption and nearest element alignment.
pagemap.@caption_alignment_v<desc>: Maximum deviation (in points) in caption and nearest element alignment.
pagemap.@mc_detect<desc>: Update elements language, alternate description and actual text based on kb. Default value is set to 1 but can be turn to 0 due to optimization - when alternate description is not required.
pagemap.@rd_sort<desc>: Sort elements: 0 - inbuild, 1 - original content positions, 2 - by x and y coordinates.
pagemap.@rd_sort_direction<desc>: Sort elements: 0 - inbuild, 1 - prefere columns, 2 - prefere rows.
pagemap.@rd_column_distance<desc>: Maximum threshold value for columns detection. Real distance in points.

template.@pagemap_regex<desc>: Regex node allows to setup general regex patterns for detection algorithm.
template.@pagemap_vars<desc>: general variables available across all queries
template.@form_object_process<desc>: Test is called when page form object is parsed.
template.@path_object_process<desc>: Test is called when page path object is parsed.
template.@image_object_process<desc>: Test is called when page image object is parsed.
template.@line_update<desc>: Updates a line after horizontal and vertical lines detection.
template.@rect_update<desc>: Updates a rect after rectangles detection.
template.@word_update<desc>: Updates a word after words detection.
template.@word_spacing<desc>: Detect word spacing between two words.

@word_spacing.@width<desc>: Word spacing beween two words in points.
@word_spacing.@ratio<desc>: Word spacing beween two words multiplied with the  points.

template.@text_line_add_word<desc>: Test is called when creating text lines from words.
template.@text_line_add_word<rule>: FIRST param pde_text_line starting from right side and adding SECOND param pde_word from left side, DIRECTION from right to left

@text_line_add_word.@join<desc>: If join is set to 'true', insert word into the current text line. If it's set to false, do not add the word into it.

template.@text_line_update<desc>: Updates a line after lines detection.

@text_line_update.@text_line_flag<desc>: Sets line regex flag. hyphen - Hyphen. new_line - New line. indent - Line has indentation. terminal - Line ended with terminal character. drop_cap - First char on the line is drop cap. filling - Line is filling only. justified- Line has large wordspacing and is probably justified.

template.@text_line_split_filling<desc>: Splits a text line based on filling.

@text_line_split_filling.@split<desc>: If false, ignnore such text line when splitting by filling.

template.@text_line_neighbours<desc>: Test if two neighbours lines can create a paragraph.
template.@text_line_neighbours<rule>: FIRST param pde_text_line is above and SECOND param pde_text_line is below, DIRECTION from top to bottom

@text_line_neighbours.@join<desc>: If join is set to 'true', these lines can be a part of one paragraph. If false, paragraph is split. If the node is not presented, lines are joined based on font size and other properties.
@text_line_neighbours.@split<desc>: If split is set to 'true', text is split in between these lines.

template.@text_update<desc>: Updates a text after paragraps detection.
template.@element_update<desc>: Updates an element after basic elements detection.
template.@table_recognize<desc>: Test is called during table recognition process - columns and rows detection. This test is called multiple times!

@table_recognize.@isolated<desc>: If isolated is set to 'true', isolated elements determine additional table coordinates. Otherwise process stops when graphic table coordinates are recognized.

template.@caption_join<desc>: Finds element for text that was marked as a caption.

@caption_join.@distance<desc>: Defines a maximum distance of caption from the element. This value updates 'caption_dist' default threshold.
@caption_join.@position<desc>: Defines a position of caption regarding to the nearest element.

template.@table_update<desc>: Updates a table after the whole process od table detection is done.

@table_update.@delete_empty<desc>: If true, empty rows and columns are deleted.
@table_update.@split<desc>: If true, all table elements are split to fit to cells.
@table_update.@span_empty<desc>: If true, empty cells are spanned together.
@table_update.@span_empty_rows_first<desc>: If true, empty rows are spanned together first then columns. False othervise
@table_update.@span_row<desc>: If true, rows are joined based on the maximum row span.
@table_update.@join<desc>: If true, all texts elements in a single cell are joined into one paragraph.
@table_update.@header<desc>: If true, table headers are detected. It's important for table tagging.

template.@table_detect_header<desc>: Defines rules for table headers detection. Tests if text is a header in a table.

@table_detect_header.@col<desc>: If true and query passed, input text is set as a column table header.
@table_detect_header.@row<desc>: If true and query passed, inout text is set as a row table header.
@table_detect_header.@row_num<desc>: If there is a number > 0 and no headers were detected, set row_num's row as table header.
@table_detect_header.@col_num<desc>: If there is a number > 0 and no headers were detected, set col_num's column as table header.

template.@table_split<desc>: Updates a table after the whole process od table detection is done.

@table_split.@row<desc>: If true, table is split by row that contains element from query.

template.@single_instance_detect<desc>: Handles elements that require a single occurence only.

@single_instance_detect.@text<desc>: If true, compare texts buffers to identify single instance.
@single_instance_detect.@left<desc>: If true, compare left coordinate to identify single instance.
@single_instance_detect.@top<desc>: If true, compare top coordinate to identify single instance.
@single_instance_detect.@widht<desc>: If true, compare element width to identify single instance.
@single_instance_detect.@height<desc>: If true, compare element height to identify single instance.

template.@alt_update<desc>: Sets alternate description for the element. Alternate description for the element is set in an order! If you want to skip some step, set false as default value for such step!
template.@alt_update<rule>: If existing Alternate Text is not EMPTY, new text will be not apply

@alt_update.@mc<desc>: If true, alternate description is taken from the original marked content and Alt tag. If there is no marked content or mc is set to false, continue to the next step.
@alt_update.@children<desc>: If true, alternate description is taken from the children of the element. Currently only PdeImage is supported. All texts from PdeTexts children inside the image are joined into the output alternate description. If there are no children node is set to false, continue to the next step.
@alt_update.@caption<desc>: If true, alternate description is taken from the nearest caption if exists.
@alt_update.@distance<desc>: Defines a maximum distance of alternate from the element. This value updates 'caption_dist' default threshold. If you want to skip this step, set value to 0.
@alt_update.@position<desc>: Defines a position of alternate regarding to the element. You can use this, if setup distance more than 0
@alt_update.@alt<desc>: If exists, alternate description is taken from this node.

template.@actual_text_update<desc>: Sets actual text for the element. Actual text for the element is set in an order! If you want to skip some step, set false as default value for such step!
template.@actual_text_update<rule>: If existing Actual Text is not EMPTY, new text will be not apply

@actual_text_update.@mc<desc>: If true, actual text is taken from the original marked content and Alt tag. If there is no marked content or mc is set to false, continue to the next step.
@actual_text_update.@children<desc>: If true, actual text is taken from the children of the element. Currently only PdeImage is supported. All texts from PdeTexts children inside the image are joined into the output alternate description. If there are no children node is set to false, continue to the next step.
@actual_text_update.@caption<desc>: If true, actual text is taken from the nearest caption if exists.
@actual_text_update.@distance<desc>: Defines a maximum distance of alternate from the element. This value updates 'caption_dist' default threshold. If you want to skip this step, set value to 0.
@actual_text_update.@position<desc>: Defines a position of alternate regarding to the element. You can use this, if setup distance more than 0.
@actual_text_update.@actual_text<desc>: If exists, actual text is taken from this node.

template.@artifact_update<desc>: Iterates detected artifact and update them.

@artifact_update.@artifact<desc>: If false, the artifact is moved back to elements - for example a background image can be moved into meaningful element.

template.@label_update<desc>: Update elements thta are marked as labels to make them a part of the list.
template.@list_update<desc>: Tests if a list is correct.

@list_update.@split<desc>: If true, splits the list back to elements. Label flag still remains on each list item.

template.@tag_image<desc>: Handles process of image tagging. For repurposing and accessibility purposes, a Figure element should have either an Alt entry or an ActualText entry in its structure element dictionary. If both are missing, default behaviour is tagged Figure with empty alt.

@tag_image.@alt<desc>: If image alternate description is presented, this value allows to set alt during the process of tagging.
@tag_image.@actual_text<desc>: If image actual text is presented, this value allows to set actual text during the process of tagging.
@tag_image.@artifact<desc>: If there is no alt or actual text presented, a Figure element should be tagged as an artifact. Setting this node to false allows tag this image with empty alt/actual even if it's not PDF/UA compliant!
@tag_image.@children<desc>: If false, all children are tagged as artifacts. If true, all image children (texts and form fields) are properly tagged (from PDF v2.0 a Figure tag can contain other tags as well).

template.@tag_table<desc>: Handles process of table tagging. For repurposing and accessibility purposes, a Table should have headers. If there are no headers detected, default behaviour is leave the table without TH.

@tag_table.@split<desc>: If there are no headers detected, a Table should be split into cells and each cell is tagged individually. Setting this node to false allows tag this table with no headers even if it's not PDF/UA compliant!
@tag_table.@row<desc>: If table needs to be split and row is true, split table to cells and use rows reading order.
@tag_table.@col<desc>: If table needs to be split and col is true, split table to cells and use cols reading order.
@tag_table.@summary<desc>: A summary of the table’s purpose and structure. For use in non-visual rendering such as speech or braille.

@tag_annot.@remove<desc>: Remove annotation from the page. Usually used for invalid annotations.

@schema.statement<desc>: The it-statement type of the query. Possible values are $if (default), $elif, $else. According to the statement the query evaluation stops upon pass or not.
@schema.statement<use>: Can by used in all functions. The it-statement type of the query. According to the statement the query evaluation stops upon pass or not. If statment is not present, is set to default.

statement.$if<desc>: Can by used in all functions. General logic of IF statement.
statement.$elif<desc>: Can by used in all functions. General logic of ELSE IF statement.
statement.$else<desc>: Can by used in all functions. General logic of ELSE statement.

@schema.query<desc>: Query defines thresholds and operations for a pagemap detection.

query.param<desc>: Define input parameters number and type.

param.pds_object_params<desc>: Parameter that represents PdsObject. Value should start with character $ that is followed by number. E.g $0_width. Number represents the index of parameter in the param array
param.pde_element_params<desc>: Parameter that represents PdeElement. Value should start with character $ that is followed by number. E.g $0_width. Number represents the index of parameter in the param array

query.var<desc>: User defined variables. Use scheme:arithmetic_operators to define variables

arithmetic_operators.$abs<desc>: Absolute value of a single number.
arithmetic_operators.$min<desc>: Get minimal value from any number of values.
arithmetic_operators.$max<desc>: Get maximal value from any number of values.
arithmetic_operators.$mod<desc>: Get the modulus from a division of values.

@schema.pds_object_params<desc>: List of all pds_object types, can be used as parameter in QUERY->PARAM.
@schema.pde_element_params<desc>: List of all pde_element types, can be used as parameter in QUERY->PARAM.

pde_table.isolated_num<desc>: Number of isolated elements in the table.

@schema.general_vars<desc>: General variables can be used without parameters. It represents general state during the processing. It contains information about the current page and the document and can be used in any query.
@schema.values<desc>: General values used in JSON default template.

values.bbox<desc>: Bounding box of PdeElement. array: [left, bottom, right, top]
values.bottom<desc>: Bottom coordinate of PdeElement bounding box.
values.cell_column<desc>: Column number of a cell in the table.
values.cell_row<desc>: Row number of a cell in the table.
values.col_num<desc>: Number of columns in the table.
values.label<desc>: Marks the element as a label.
values.left<desc>: Left coordinate of PdeElement bounding box.
values.pdf_rect<desc>: Parameter that represents PdsObject. array: [left, bottom, right, top]
values.pdf_rgb<desc>: Parameter that represents PdfRgb values: [red, green, blue].
values.reflow<desc>: Sets text reflow. If reflow is set to false, each line is marked as a new line.
values.right<desc>: Right coordinate of PdeElement bounding box.
values.row_num<desc>: Number of rows in the table.
values.top<desc>: Top coordinate of PdeElement bounding box.
values.type<desc>: Mark object or element as type. It helps to recognize correct element type.

@schema.suffix<desc>: Container holding all unique suffixes used for naming in JSON default template
@schema.suffix<rule>: If element name has suffix, its taken as additional data about element before suffix and its not read by program as a child of element(his possible value).

suffix.<use>: Description how to use function, object, value or anything else.
suffix.<value>: Array of possible values of element.
suffix.<rule>: Describes how the element setup works.
suffix.<num_values>: Number of values needs to be set.
suffix.<link>: Refer to the target element in JSON, which contain needed data.
suffix.<insert>: Value will be used as TreeItem for inserting into TreeView JSON structer

@schema.keywords<desc>: Container holding all unique keywords used in JSON default template

keywords.general<desc>: Holding general data like: version, date, id, SDK version, ...
keywords.query<desc>: Can be used in all functions. Each QUERY must have child PARAM, which holding array of parameters to specified query objects.
keywords.param<desc>: Child of QUERY. Each QUERY must have PARAM. Holding array of parameters to specified query objects.
keywords.statement<desc>: Should by used in all main functions nodes. The it-statement type of the query. According to the statement the query evaluation stops upon pass or not. If statment is not present, the condition is considered as disabled.
keywords.disable<desc>: Can by used in all main functions nodes. If value is false, node is not executed by SDK. If this keyword is not present, is used default value disabled = false.
keywords.purpose<desc>: Describes for what is used QUERY
